name: Inflow Direct Interaction — Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 1)
description: Freeze if direct inflow (Hop 1) from Sanctions, Terrorism Financing, Public Freezing Action, Illicit Markets, or Other Financial Crimes. Direct interaction indicates intentional or negligent exposure per OFAC Critical-level guidance.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 Section 6 & OFAC SDN Direct Contact = Critical

name: Inflow Near-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 2-3)
description: Freeze if near-distance inflow (Hop 2-3) from Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen entities. Near-distance exposure still represents significant taint requiring immediate containment.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 & TrustIn SG DPT Guide Section 1.A

name: Inflow Far-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 4-5)
description: Trigger EDD if far-distance inflow (Hop 4-5) from Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen entities. Pollution decay principle: risk reduces with distance, but sanctions exposure still requires enhanced investigation.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 & Pollution Decay Principle (OFAC Indirect Benefits)

name: Inflow Exposure — Cybercrime/Obfuscation/Gambling/High-Risk (Threshold)
description: Trigger EDD if inflow exposure to Cybercrime, Mixers, Gambling, or High-Risk Entities exceeds 10% AND risk amount > 50 USD.
reference: TrustIn KYA Pro SG DPT Guide Section 1.B & 2.2

name: Inflow Exposure — Grey Industry/Spam (Threshold)
description: Trigger SOF Review if inflow exposure to Grey Industry or Spam exceeds 30% AND risk amount > 1000 USD.
reference: TrustIn KYA Pro SG DPT Guide Section 1.C & 2.2

name: Outflow History — Target Directly Funded Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 1)
description: Freeze if the target address has directly sent funds (Hop 1 outflow) to Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen entities. Direct outflow to sanctioned entities indicates intentional interaction — far more severe than passive inflow exposure.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 & OFAC Prohibition on Providing Indirect Benefits

name: Outflow History — Target Indirectly Funded Sanctions/Terrorism (Hop 2-3)
description: Trigger EDD if the target address has indirectly funded (Hop 2-3 outflow) Sanctions or Terrorism entities. Indirect outflow through intermediaries still requires enhanced investigation.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 & OFAC Prohibition on Providing Indirect Benefits

name: Target Self-Tag — Sanctions/Freeze/Illicit
description: Freeze if the target address itself is tagged as Sanctions, Terrorism Financing, Public Freezing Action, Illicit Markets, or Other Financial Crimes. Applies to both onboarding and deposit — risk changes over time, an address clean at onboarding may be flagged later.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 Section 6 (CDD/Ongoing CDD) & FATF Recommendation 10

name: Target Self-Tag — Cybercrime/Obfuscation
description: Trigger EDD if the target address itself is tagged as Cybercrime or Obfuscation. Applies to both onboarding and deposit — addresses may acquire new risk labels after onboarding due to evolving threat intelligence.

name: CEX Whitelist Stop Rule
description: Stop penetrating graph paths if a known CEX or TradFi institution is encountered to prevent false positives.
reference: TrustIn KYA Pro SG DPT Guide Section 2.1

name: Outflow Direct Interaction — Sanctions/Terrorism Destination (Hop 1)
description: Freeze if direct outflow (Hop 1) reaches Sanctions, Terrorism, or Frozen destination. Sending funds directly to sanctioned entities is the highest-severity withdrawal risk.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 Section 8 (STR) & FATF Recommendation 20

name: Outflow Near-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism Destination (Hop 2-3)
description: Freeze if near-distance outflow (Hop 2-3) reaches Sanctions or Terrorism destination. Near-distance outflow to sanctioned entities still requires containment per CFT obligations.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 Section 8 & TrustIn SG DPT Guide (Outflow 3-5 Hops)

name: Outflow Far-Distance — Sanctions/Terrorism Destination (Hop 4-5)
description: Trigger EDD if far-distance outflow (Hop 4-5) reaches Sanctions or Terrorism destination. Pollution decay applies but sanctions obligations require enhanced investigation.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 & Pollution Decay Principle

name: Outflow Exposure — Cybercrime/Obfuscation/Gambling Destination (Threshold)
description: Trigger EDD if outflow reaches Cybercrime, Obfuscation, Gambling, or High-Risk destination with exposure > 10% AND amount > 50 USD.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 Section 6 (EDD) & TrustIn SG DPT Guide

name: Withdrawal Gate — Target Self-Tagged (Sanctions/Freeze/Illicit)
description: Freeze withdrawal if the target address itself is tagged as Sanctions, Terrorism Financing, Public Freezing Action, Illicit Markets, or Other Financial Crimes. Prevents sanctioned or frozen addresses from moving funds out.
reference: MAS Notice PSN02 Section 6 & 8 (Ongoing CDD + STR)

name: Withdrawal Gate — Target Self-Tagged (Cybercrime/Obfuscation)
description: Trigger EDD on withdrawal if the target address itself is tagged as Cybercrime or Obfuscation. High-risk tagged addresses require enhanced investigation before allowing fund movement.

name: Travel Rule Verification
description: Trigger Travel Rule verification if single transfer > 1000 USD (~ 1350 SGD).
reference: TrustIn KYA Pro SG DPT Guide Section 2.3

name: Occasional Transaction KYC Trigger
description: Trigger full KYC/CDD if occasional transaction amount > 3500 USD (~ 4700 SGD).
reference: TrustIn KYA Pro SG DPT Guide Section 2.3

name: Structuring Alert (Daily Volume)
description: Trigger alert if daily cumulative deposit > 3000 USD (Anti-smurfing).
reference: TrustIn KYA Pro SG DPT Guide Section 2.3
